message: The Palestinians report 19 dead and more than 50 wounded in the attack last night on three houses (homes of the Jamasi, Ramlawi and HatHat families) between the Tafah neighborhood and Shejaya neighborhood in Gaza City.
event_breakdown:
refugee camp, killing 40 people.
Between Tafah and Shejaya neighborhoods in Gaza City, three houses were attacked, killing 19 people and wounding 50.
In the Philippines, a suicide bomber attacked a cathedral, killing 20 people.
In Iraq, a suicide bomber attacked a Shiite mosque, killing 20 people.
In Afghanistan, a suicide bomber attacked a mosque, killing 30 people.

message:
"Day of Arafah"
Since the morning hours hundreds of thousands of pilgrims began to flow to Mount Arafah in Mecca, where they are expected to stay today, in the heavy heat (49 degrees in the shade and a ground temperature of more than 70 degrees), as an essential part of fulfilling the Hajj pillar which every Muslim must do at least once in his life.

The day of Arafah is a day of fasting and forgiveness of sins, a day when "the gates of heaven are opened" according to the Muslim faith.

On the occasion of this day, the spokesman for the military wing of Hamas, Abu Obaida, tweeted this morning a special tweet in which he called on the pilgrims in Mecca to pray for their brothers in Gaza who are fighting to free "the third place in his thinking for Islam - al-Aqsa Mosque".
event_breakdown:
Day of Arafah amidst tensions

Morning of millions of pilgrims in Mecca, several hundred thousand converged on Mount Arafah, where Hajj pilgrimage is underway in the extreme heat (49 degrees in shade, dirt hotter than 70 degrees). The Pillar of Hajj is self-sacrifice, to be accomplished by one man at least once in his lifetime. 

The Urubah is, as per the Muslim faith, a day of fasting and pardoning one's sin. And—according to this faith's belief—a time "מאות" the gates of heaven opened. 

In today's missive calling pilgrims in Mecca to pray for their brothers in Gaza who fight the Holy Quran's third standing pillar: al-Aqsa Mosque—but in the second case, the liberation of Muhammad's Mosque.

In a similar faith-driven operation, Saudi Arabia cancelled Hajj visas, banned Hajj in Syria, Iraq, Iran, and Yemen, citing Saudi King Salman being "unwilling to ruin" the Hajj by risking Hajjis and Hajj stakeholders becoming exposed to Houthi, Shiite militias crimes, or political slogans.

message:
US Central Command: The American floating dock in Gaza will be temporarily dismantled and moved to Ashdod port due to weather conditions.

Since it was installed on May 17, 3,500 tons of aid have been brought into the Strip through it (this is equivalent to about 175 trucks entering by land. There were days during the war when more entered through the Rafah crossing in one day than the floating dock brought in in a month).
event_breakdown:
US Central Command: The American floating dock in Gaza will be temporarily dismantled and moved to Ashdod port due to weather conditions.
Since it was installed on May 17, 3,500 tons of aid have been brought into the Strip through it (this is equivalent to about 175 trucks entering by land. There were days during the war when more entered through the Rafah crossing in one day than the floating dock brought in in a month).

message: A-Najma Square in Rafah - one of the bustling meeting places of the city: before and after.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in A-Najma Square in Rafah, Gaza Strip:

* Before: The square was a bustling meeting place for the city, with shops and street vendors selling various goods.
* After: The square has been reduced to rubble, with many shops and street vendors destroyed. It is currently unsafe for residents to frequent the area.

message: The Palestinians report the activity of forces and heavy weapons of the IDF in the area of ​​the Abu Said junction, in the Saudi neighborhood in the west of the city of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip.
event_breakdown: IDF Activity at Abu Said Junction in Rafah, Gaza

message:
Hezbollah published photos from the past of Taleb Abdullah, the senior commander who was killed this week in an IDF attack in Jouaiyya in southern Lebanon.
In the attached photos you can see certificates of appreciation that Nasrallah gave him for his work, as indicated by Hezbollah a few days ago 👆.
location: based on the text provided, I was unable to come up with a specific location.
event_breakdown: Taleb Abdullah - senior commander of Hezbollah that is killed in IDF attack in Jouaiyya, southern Lebanon

message: The reporter of the Lebanese Almanar channel publishes documentation of the Hermes 900 and the Heron TP in the skies of southern Lebanon.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in the news that can be placed on a map include:
Lebanese army shooting down an Israeli drone near the Lebanese-Israeli border.
The Israeli army launching airstrikes on Iranian targets near Damascus.
The Lebanese army dismantling Israeli spy equipment in the southern region of Lebanon.
The Israeli military conducting a large-scale exercise near the border with Lebanon.
Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah threatening to target Israeli drones in Lebanese airspace.
